message: yes
um $5

and you can copy and paste the URL anywhere... maybe I'm missing something
I am tempted to create another user so I can follow more than 20 groups...
sorry
would you then be presented with a list of your groups?
or, it could just be one click, as you hover over the username, you are presented with common options - one being invite / reco....
You can invite someone to a group.. or @ message them with a link to a group you recommend (or even from the group you recommend)
I don't feel like it needs to be a feature.. I mean, invite is pretty direct
is it just me or does EVERY chat thing say less than a minute ago
would be nice to sort groups by # of topics too
this site is kewl
maybe it's more that recommending things could be surfaced later through pushing users to invite more
and education about the easily copy-and-pasteable urls
yeah, like i'm picturing a drop down next to the users name > recommend group

@psytek Yeah, group discovery is the best aspect of a follow system I can think of. It would be messy to see every time one of my friends posted in a topic (and again, stalker-y!), and I can't think of much else. So, maybe important to see if they just created, joined, or left a group, and perhaps whether or not they were just promoted to admin (so that you can send flowers and other lovely gifts, of course).

Could also mention when they star something someone said, perhaps*? It's not exactly seeing what topic they're in all the time, or every one of their comments, but gives you the opportunity to see something they like. (* May also be on that privacy borderline, not sure myself how I feel about it)
one on one chat
i made the group cats. yay for me

@psytek We chatted about this earlier a bit, seems a little stalkerish at that point. But seeing some information about friends would be nice, at least to know what groups they're discovering so that you can do the same. I think that discovery aspect is a big part of the system.

lol
would be cool to correct spelling errors on previous messages without deleting them
it makes it easy to give instant feedback without formulating something to say
good point about the star. Let me scratch my beard for a second :-p
would be cool to have upvote / downvote on replies
what would it achieve? (not being argumentative, just wondering what it would add)
well the star is almost like an upvote
I'm coming around to pickles. Not a must have feature but I think they're light-hearted enough to be ok. A minus sign is (by nature, duh) so negative!
sometimes silence is approval
ROFL

The +/- thing doesn't really add to the conversation constructively though. By hitting minus all you're saying is 'I don't like this'. You wouldn't type that though, you'd type 'I don't like this because', which adds to the conversation, right?
This is giving me a headache kind of. Neutral is negative in the context of a conversation though... (??)
lol
another metric - I'd be able to tell someone that I don't like their reply without scything anything
saying*
is being ignored not enough of a message?
how about next to the star you have a pickle
ignoring is just neutral
haha
yeah, cool :) I agree
a silent star-silent?

^ http://ualoo.com/images/pickles.jpg
I just starred myself for that. Which is the convore version of giving yourself a f&*$ing medal
you might be interested in this topic after that: https://convore.com/lulz/lol-irl/

I could use a (private/personal) flag for items I want to take a closer look at when I have time (todo reads). Perhaps a pickle it just the thing? How about a pig symbol for the waisting bandwidth posts?
How about a fixed width option (and carriage returns) so I can post an ugly stack trace?
Oh gaud! how do you link to a post!!
Make the pig button a strip of bacon maybe - every loves bacon, and you can positively waste bandwidth (see Lulz group!)

@psytek I don't know that deleting replies from a centralized location is the best idea...throws off the flow of conversation in the thread and makes things confusing (and how many people would commonly want to do that?). If you really need to delete a comment, you can go to it directly and do so.
A cool feature to have is "watch groups" so you don't necessarily have to join them, and can watch all of the replies that are happening.  This way you'd know if you want to join or not.
and have the option to check them off and delete them
Would also be cool to see stars per topic and  not just the whole group
also be able to search groups individually (this may have been mentioned before)
I would really like to see all of the replies I have sent.
and be able to sort replies by # of stars received
@michaelschade yeah thats fine, as long as I can see them all at once.  I'm ok with going into the topic to delete it.
Yeah, I think sorting by # of stars in a group will be good to.  For instance the crew can see which suggestions got starred the most and work on those first.
maybe a way to get alerts when any reply in a group is starred
I'd like a ignore topic flag.  There's topics that I have no interest in know about
A global recent topics page would be nice as well. A one stop shop for all the newest topics from all my groups.
new topic counts in the favicon like gmail does for Chrome and Firefox: http://imgur.com/q7eK6
Kind of wish twitter had the same star system as Convore.  RTing takes too long.
